ygData.subject: Re: Price Fixing
ygData.msgSnippet: ... actual ... spoilage, ... 15pp to make Oh, so you ARE out to make a profit then... (see your comments below) ... farmer A can t produce as apples as
ygData.messageBody:
> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> >>> "Lemac Justerian" <lemac@...> 5.20.99 2:36:08 PM >>>
> >>>Oh, so do you think that the grocery store only charges you for the
actual
> >>>cost of the product YOU are buying? and not their 'losses' from
spoilage,
> >>>theft, etc?
>
> a. I didn't say I sold at cost, do the math, a tunic cost way less than
15pp to make

Oh, so you ARE out to make a profit then... (see your comments below)

> b. at the grocery store I'm not being charged outrageous fees because
farmer A can't produce as apples as efficiently as farmer B

Well, actually you are... and they too use 'price fixing' at the wholesale
level by selling to brokers who then mark it up and sell to distributors who
then mark it up and sell to you. But if famer A doesn't grow as many apples
he is 'subsidized' on his pricing to match... Have you not noticed there are
'seasons' for fruit? even though you can get fruit in ALL seasons? It is
called SUPPLY AND DEMAND.

> c. If I feel grocery store A is charging too much I go to grocery store B
and buy the same merchandise at a lower price, so its up to grocer A to
lower their prices to meet consumer need/want, not up to grocer B to raise
their price to match the market "standards".

Then do you go around and call the first store SCUM? Or do you let them do
business because some people don't just shop on price, but on service and
other reasons? Sounds like you are interested in LOW PRICES...

> >>>So yes, you do have to consider costs of failures too... If a 'client'
came
> >>>up to you with all the raw materials and said "Make me a tunic and I
will
> >>>give you 5pp." Would you tell them Okay without mentioning that it
*might
> >>>not* work and they would be out the 5pp for the raw materials? Or, if
you
> >>>failed with their materials would you then use your own until you were
able
> >>>to produce one for them? This would be a bad thing for you if it
did... But
> >>>if that is your thinking, then the heck with ME learning to smith, I am
> >>>going to start ordering stuff from you all the time!!
>
> I don't work like that, if someone came up to me and said they had the
materials, I would offer to buy the materials, then charge them my normal
price. But that has never happened to me...
>
> >>>In fact, please put me down for two tunics (I will sell one for 20pp
and
> >>>mine will only cost 10), or better yet, make it FOUR! I can get a
discount
> >>>for multiples, right?? hehe... (let's see now, if I get them for 13pp
each
> >>>x4=52 plat... I can sell 3 x20=60... I get mine free AND make 8 plat!
All
> >>>without smithing!! Kewl!!)
>
> a. I sell tunics for 15, you should read more carefully

I did read carefully... do the math... two tunics (at your price) would be
30p... I would sell one for 20, then mine would only cost me 10 ---
20+10=30p But you wouldn't offer any discounts? Oh, so YOUR prices ARE
fixed then?

> b. people like you make me sick.....you'd take advantage of someone
trying to do the community a favor (me) by buying my stuff cheap and selling
at much higher prices for your own personal gain. "Screw thy fellow man"
must be your motto of life.

hey, hey, hey... If you feel ill, perhaps it is because you don't like to
hear about others making money off of 'Your' stuff... Well, that's the way
it is done all over... Buy cheap, sell for a profit... Heck, YOU are doing
it too! You make money off of the 'skill' of smithing... Is it wrong for
someone else to make money off of the 'skill' of selling? If I can sell
your products for you, to others you don't know, or can't reach, then am I
not helping you also? or do you want Exclusive rights to everything you
sell? Or do you just want to FIX the price of something that YOU make.

> c. You would get no such discount from me, infact I'd probably charge you
40pp per tunic due to your own greed.

Oh, and your not greedy at all... No discounts, Fixed price of 15p but it
costs you only 5p, so that is 150% profit... No, that is a FAIR markup,
isn't it? Sure, you don't mind paying 150% markup on your things, do you?
But if someone else tries to mark it up 33% above THEIR cost (20p selling vs
15p they would pay you) then THEY are the greedy ones, eh? Tsk, tsk... And
you STILL would make 150% profit...


> >>>Of course if I order more, you should give me an even BIGGER discount
> >>>because, after all, I am HELPING you to learn to be a better smith,
right?
> >>>Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana
>
> I generally don't give discounts on bulk purchases because either someone
is trying to take advantage of my low prices, or they are trying to twink
out their guild buddies.

And that would hurt you how? Because you don't want to sell to his buddies?
or because you think that YOU are the only one that should sell to them?
Convienent for you, but not necessarily for them... If you are only on 4
hours a night, and someone else is on 4 hours in the DAY, they cannot buy
your products, and you cannot sell to them... But heaven forbid someone else
would want to use their time and effort to provide YOUR products for sale to
others...

Think small, be small...

I only hope that when I can finally make armor and sell it, that I can sell
AS MUCH AS I CAN MAKE for a GOOD price to make ME a profit... Smithing is a
business as well as a service... I already give away my healings and buffs
without charging my fellow players... Why shouldn't I try to make a profit
for myself smithing or reselling?

Lemac
